articles.headline: Justice Department Opposes United-Delta Swap for Newark Landing Slots
articles.snippet: The agency says that an agreement between the airlines to swap takeoff and landing spots between Newark and Kennedy airports would harm competition.
articles.abstract: The agency says that an agreement between the airlines to swap takeoff and landing spots between Newark and Kennedy airports would harm competition.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department said on Tuesday that it would seek to block United Airlines from further expanding its hold at Newark Liberty International Airport because the carrier already has a near monopoly there.

articles.headline: Prosecutors Announce More Charges in Hacking of JPMorgan Chase
articles.snippet: A superseding indictment says three men hacked into banks, brokers and financial information publishing companies.
articles.abstract: A superseding indictment says three men hacked into banks, brokers and financial information publishing companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Billing it as the largest hacking case ever uncovered, federal prosecutors in Manhattan on Tuesday described a global, multiyear scheme to steal information on 100 million customers of a dozen companies in the United States and use the data to advance stock manipulation activities, illicit online gambling and fraud.

articles.headline: Valeant Chief Says Issues Stem From Fast Growth
articles.snippet: J. Michael Pearson, the pharmaceutical company’s chief executive, said in a conference call with investors that the company was strong, despite recent issues.
articles.abstract: J. Michael Pearson, the pharmaceutical company’s chief executive, said in a conference call with investors that the company was strong, despite recent issues.
articles.lead_paragraph: J. Michael Pearson, the embattled chief executive of Valeant Pharmaceuticals International, sought on Tuesday to reassure investors that the once highflying company still had a solid future despite a steep fall in its stock price and growing questions about its business model and debt levels.

articles.headline: India Is Caught in a Climate Change Quandary
articles.snippet: An impoverished nation must balance domestic demands for development and international demands to limit greenhouse gas emissions.
articles.abstract: An impoverished nation must balance domestic demands for development and international demands to limit greenhouse gas emissions.
articles.lead_paragraph: Spare a thought for poor India.

articles.headline: A Real Missouri ‘Concerned Student 1950’ Speaks, at Age 89
articles.snippet: Gus T. Ridgel, one of the first black students admitted to the University of Missouri, said he was surprised and disappointed by the racist incidents that prompted the recent campus upheaval.
articles.abstract: Gus T. Ridgel, one of the first black students admitted to the University of Missouri, said he was surprised and disappointed by the racist incidents that prompted the recent campus upheaval.
articles.lead_paragraph: They named themselves Concerned Student 1950, in reference to the year the first black students were admitted to the University of Missouri.

articles.headline: Dizzying Ride May Be Ending for Tech Start-Ups
articles.snippet: The latest sign of growing unease over the valuations of some richly priced companies has emerged with Snapchat being discounted 25 percent by Fidelity, the mutual fund giant.
articles.abstract: The latest sign of growing unease over the valuations of some richly priced companies has emerged with Snapchat being discounted 25 percent by Fidelity, the mutual fund giant.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The worth of hot technology start-ups seemed for years to go in only one direction: straight up.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Katie Benner

articles.headline: In Republican Debate, Candidates Battle Sharply on Immigration
articles.snippet: Gov. John Kasich of Ohio and former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida tried to gain political momentum by heaping scorn on Donald J. Trump’s plan to deport unauthorized immigrants.
articles.abstract: Gov. John Kasich of Ohio and former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida tried to gain political momentum by heaping scorn on Donald J. Trump’s plan to deport unauthorized immigrants.
articles.lead_paragraph: MILWAUKEE — After weeks of personal sniping, the Republican presidential candidates clashed sharply over immigration and other policies in their debate here on Tuesday, with Gov. John Kasich of Ohio and former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida trying to energize their campaigns by heaping scorn on Donald J. Trump’s plan to deport unauthorized immigrants.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Patrick Healy

articles.headline: Anheuser-Busch InBev Completes Agreement for SABMiller
articles.snippet: The deal, worth nearly $106 billion, would create a behemoth in the beer industry and would include SABMiller’s sale of its 58 percent stake in MillerCoors.
articles.abstract: The deal, worth nearly $106 billion, would create a behemoth in the beer industry and would include SABMiller’s sale of its 58 percent stake in MillerCoors.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Anheuser-Busch InBev said on Wednesday that it had completed an agreement to acquire its closest rival, SABMiller, for nearly $106 billion, creating what it said would be the first “truly global brewer.”

articles.headline: Singles Day in China Draws New Suitors: Foreign Sellers
articles.snippet: The annual frenzy of discount shopping — to the tune of more than $14 billion in 24 hours – offers a way into the country’s growing middle-class market, companies say.
articles.abstract: The annual frenzy of discount shopping — to the tune of more than $14 billion in 24 hours – offers a way into the country’s growing middle-class market, companies say.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Over the last year, A2, an Australian milk company, made an unexpected discovery: A sharp increase in domestic sales came from Chinese bulk buyers, not local mothers.
articles.byline: By Amie Tsang and Cao Li

articles.headline: E.U. Move to Label Israeli Settlement Goods Strains Ties
articles.snippet: Officials insisted the guidelines were not a new policy — merely a clarification of existing rules — but Israel quickly denounced the move as a form of discrimination.
articles.abstract: Officials insisted the guidelines were not a new policy — merely a clarification of existing rules — but Israel quickly denounced the move as a form of discrimination.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — In a stinging rebuke to Israel, the European Union insisted on Wednesday that some goods produced on land seized in the 1967 war must be labeled “made in settlements,” a mandate that added to Israel’s deep unease over a growing international boycott.
articles.byline: By Jodi Rudoren and Sewell Chan

articles.headline: Airbnb Pledges to Work With Cities and Pay ‘Fair Share’ of Taxes
articles.snippet: After helping defeat Proposition F in San Francisco, which would have limited the home-sharing service, the company has pledged to cooperate with local governments.
articles.abstract: After helping defeat Proposition F in San Francisco, which would have limited the home-sharing service, the company has pledged to cooperate with local governments.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A week ago, Airbnb  fired off a warning shot to cities that it would fight back if municipal officials proposed rules that might curtail its home-sharing service.

articles.headline: At University of Missouri, Black Students See a Campus Riven by Race
articles.snippet: Many black students say that racial tensions were already woven into the fabric of everyday life at the University of Missouri, well before the recent cascade of events.
articles.abstract: Many black students say that racial tensions were already woven into the fabric of everyday life at the University of Missouri, well before the recent cascade of events.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLUMBIA, Mo. — At first, Briana Gray just chalked up the comments and questions from her new roommate at the University of Missouri to innocent ignorance: How do you style your hair? What do you put in it?
